result.execSummary:
The defendant Alma D. Hall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contract Req'mts - Changes in Writing, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes ATCP110.05(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $1969.00 and restitution surcharge.

Pay court costs.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
------------------------------------

of Restitution Hearing

Subpoena- D.W.
Subpoena- S.W.

Defendant Alma D. Hall in court with attorney James M. Dickinson.  Haley Jo Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 5, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Status conference at 08-19-2015 08:30 am
Defendant Alma D. Hall in court with attorney James M. Dickinson.   Atty A. Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes Filed.  Status conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S):  NO CONTACT WITH D.W. AND S.W.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Defendant Alma D. Hall in court with attorney James M. Dickinson.  Daniel A. Necci appeared with intern Mackenzie Fagan for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
